prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "未経験介護職" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled: Correct. The most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー" from the options given is "介護職" (knowledge worker).

While options B and C both include the term "有資格" (having qualifications), this is not a necessary or accurate characteristic for a caregiver, as the reference information states that it is possible to work as a caregiver without a caregiving qualification. Therefore, options B and C are not appropriate.

Option D includes both "介護職" and "正社員", which are two separate terms referring to different types of employment, and therefore is not the most accurate choice.

Option E includes the terms "介護職" and "正社員", which are not accurate as standalone qualifications, and adds the term "有資格" which is not clear about the type of qualifications the person has. Therefore option E is not the most accurate choice.

Option F combines the qualification and employment type, which is not accurate as the term "介護職" refers to the job type, not the qualifications.

Option G is similar to F, adding the term "有資格" which is not clear about the type of qualifications the person has. Therefore option G is not the most accurate choice.

Therefore, the most accurate paraphrase is "介護職（無資格）".

prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー／パート・アルバイト" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
The most accurate paraphrase of "ケアスタッフ（無資格）" would be "介護職（無資格）".

解析：
選項A「介護職」と「B「介護職（有資格）」は同義語であるため、正確な解答はA。選項C「介護職（無資格）」では、「介護職」という複減表現に使われており、無資格でも業互いに関連する業務を行う場合に適用されることがあるため、正確です。選項D「介護職／正社員」では、「介護職」と「正社員」を識別する単語を使わず、熟練した語幹で書かれた文を意味しているため、誤解を招く可能性がある。選項E「介護職／パート・アルバイト」は「介護職」を使って、「無資格」と「正職」を区別するための表現であることから、重複或る表現がScrollViewとして見られるものであるため、正確ではいかない。選項F「介護職（有資格）／正社員」は、「介護職」以外の状態の「有資格」と「正社員」を提供する仕組みを意味するため、正確です。選項G「介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト」は単純であり、「介護職」と「有資格」が別々の属性を持つことを示す文という表現で使われるため、正確ではいかない。したがって、選項A「介護職（無資格）」が最も正確な解答である。
